channel.title: Break the path, excite new thinking.
channel.description: Break the path, excite new thinking.

item.title: Lauren Peterson
item.description:
Lauren Peterson

Lauren Peterson collects "devalued" objects (what we mostly think of as trash) and re-contextualizes them to talk about their switch from functional to material. Lauren works in a studio at Atlanta's Goat Farm Arts Center as part of MINT Gallery's Leap Year program for 2015/16. Also available on YouTube.

item.title: Community Architect: The Secrets of a Comeback Neighborhood
item.description: Community Architect: The Secrets of a Comeback Neighborhood

item.title: Meet a blacksmith: Mark Hopper
item.description:
Meet a blacksmith: Mark Hopper

Mark Hopper: I grew up making things. My grandfather was a cabinet maker, so every summer we'd hang out in his woodshed: painting, playing with charcoals and pastels. I eventually got into woodwork and wanted to make the metal components that went into it.
